folder: St. Marks Place & Westervelt Avenue, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Westervelt Avenue
text:
St. Marks Place, north side, east of Westervelt Avenue, showing St. Peters Roman Catholic Church. The view is westward along St. Marks Place. View 1 was taken September, 1925; view 2, May 2, 1928,and view 3, June 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr
View S. Neg a 797

folder: St. Marks Place & Westervelt Avenue, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Westervelt Avenue
text:
St. Marks Place, north side, east of Westervelt Avenue, showing St. Peters Roman Catholic Church. The house with the dormer windows, adjoining the church, is the rectory. View 1 was taken March 10, 1928. Views 2 and 3 show the rear of the church as seen from Richmond Terrace and were taken July 20, 1926
and April 26, 1937, respectively.
P. L. Sperr

folder: St. Marks Place & Westervelt Avenue, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Westervelt Avenue
text:
St. Marks Plaoe (extreme left), east from (No. 100) a point 300 yards east of Westervelt Avenue to Nicholas Street. The vantage poirt is hhe old Stokes Mansion. In the background is visible the
Upper New York Bay.
March 1928
P. L. Sperr

folder: St. Marks Place & Westervelt Avenue, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Westervelt Avenue
text:
St. Marks Place, east from Westervelt Avenue, showing
St. Peters Roman Catholic Church where the street makes a sharp bend.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
